speaker: Ronee
text: Hey, you're up early.  Rain wake you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, just a little preoccupied.

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, if there's something on your mind you can tell me. Won't be long before I'm your mom.

speaker: Frasier
text: I was actually gonna tell you before you said that.

speaker: Ronee
text: [_sitting_] Oh, come on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there's this woman I can't seem to get off of my mind. A woman with a boyfriend.

speaker: Ronee
text: Why don't you just get her drunk and see what happens?

speaker: Frasier
text: You are nothing like my mother.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Ronee, better get dressed.  You can't look like that when she gets here.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh, she not coming for another hour.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who?

speaker: Martin
text: Ronee's mother.

speaker: Ronee
text: Your grandmother.

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop that!

speaker: Martin
text: She's visiting with her church group from Spokane.

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah, and if she sees me like dressed this she'd know that I spent the night and then she'd be carping about it the whole weekend.

speaker: Frasier
text: What, she doesn't approve of pre-marital sex?

speaker: Ronee
text: Judging by the diving bell she wore as a nightgown, she wasn't real big on post-marital sex either.

speaker: Martin
text: Plus, I'm startin' out with one strike against me.

speaker: Ronee
text: Mother still remembers a night he drove me home from babysitting you and Niles, thirty years ago...

speaker: Martin
text: Forty years ago.

speaker: Ronee
text: I'm telling this story.  I was all weepy because this guy had just dumped me, and your father put his arm around me, just to be nice.  And Mom saw it and she thought he was trying to rob me of my virtue.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_getting up_] Oh, that's crazy.

speaker: Ronee
text: I know, like there was anything left to rob.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, don't worry.  It's been a long time since I've had to charm the mother of one of my girlfriends, but, believe me, it's a skill you don't lose. _Ronee gets up from the table.  Behind Frasier, the elevator opens and a woman steps out._

speaker: Betty
text: Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Mrs. Lawrence, how lovely to see you again.  Ronee should be here any minute.  _He pulls the door behind him as Ronee gets down, then crawls for the bedroom._

speaker: Betty
text: Yes, well, I'm a little early.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, there's no problem.

speaker: Betty
text: I'm not inconveniencing you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, not at all.

speaker: Betty
text: I could come back later.

speaker: Frasier
text: I wouldn't think of it.

speaker: Betty
text: Well, then can I come in?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes of course.  Where are my manners?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, let me take your coat.

speaker: Betty
text: Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Ronee, we were just talkin'... wait.  Mrs. Lawrence? Wow, you look wonderful!  Ronee isn't here at the moment, so why don't I give you a little tour?  We can start in the kitchen.

speaker: Betty
text: Still all hands I see.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, Mrs. Lawrence, kitchen's right here.  You know, you look the same as you did the last time I saw you.

speaker: Betty
text: What are you saying?  That I looked like this at forty? _They go into the kitchen.  Ronee rushes for the front door, then rings the bell._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll get it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait!  It's pouring rain outside.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why, look who's here.  It's Ronee. _Ronee, soaking wet, just waves at her mom coming out of the kitchen.  FADE OUT  Scene 2 - Cafe Nervosa  Fade in.  Niles and Daphne are sitting at a table.  Frasier comes in the front._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, you two.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!  Whatever plans you have for this evening, cancel them.  I'm taking you to a fantastic new restaurant.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sitting_] Well, all right.  Where are we going?  Chez Paul? Kobu?

speaker: Daphne
text: Burger-Burger-Burger.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God, you're serious.

speaker: Niles
text: I know what you're thinking.  Not two days ago I was just like you.  Too good to walk into any one of their seventy-one convenient locations.

speaker: Daphne
text: Then I dragged him in there yesterday for lunch when I was craving a Bacon Cheese Burger-Burger-Burger.  He liked it so much he insisted we try the Chick 'n' Bucket for dinner.  I guess he's got the fast food bug.

speaker: Frasier
text: And which one would that be?  E. coli?

speaker: Niles
text: Now, now, keep an open mind.  After all, you've embraced the peasant cuisine of Italy and France, why shun the peasants in our own backyard?

speaker: Frasier
text: You've changed, Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_rising_] He hasn't changed that much.  He sent back his Big Slurp.  Goodbye, Darling

speaker: Niles
text: 'Bye, Darling.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, Niles, but, you know, I think I'll pass.  Spend a night in, curled up with a good book.  I didn't get much sleep last night.

speaker: Roz
text: So, Frasier.  What was going on with you at work today? You seemed a little distracted.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm, I'm not really sure.  I can't stop thinking about this woman I've met.  It's my matchmaker, of all people.

speaker: Niles
text: Now, do you get a discount if the matchmaker sets you up with herself?  Sort of a floor model sort of thing?

speaker: Roz
text: I thought you were kind of ticked off at her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I was, and then we had dinner together last night. And, God, we were so comfortable with each other, it's like we've known each other for ages.

speaker: Roz
text: So ask her out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I can't.  She's got a boyfriend.  And, truth be told, I'm not sure why I'm so obsessed with her, I  barely even know her.  Niles, listen, is it possible that this is just a case of transference?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, interesting.  Uh, hmm... a matchmaker's not unlike a therapist.  You confide in them, seek guidance.   It's only natural you'd develop a little crush on her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, precisely!  Now, how many times has a patient fallen for you?

speaker: Niles
text: You first.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't be such a baby.  This is not a competition.

speaker: Niles
text: Eleven.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thirteen.  You know, this is really a weight of my shoulders. It's just simple transference.  Thank you, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_rising_] Yes, well, I'm glad to be of help.  You know, when I said eleven earlier, actually I...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughing_] Too late, Niles, off you go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's a relief.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_] Charlotte.  Hi, good to see you.  Uh, I'd like you to meet, uh...

speaker: Roz
text: Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier's producer.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Hi. [_to Frasier_] You know, that was fun last night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes it was. We should do it again sometime.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, I'd love to.  When I'm back in town.  I'm going camping.

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't realize you were an outdoorswoman.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I'm not.  The last time I camped out it was for Van Halen tickets.  But Frank loves it and I'll do anything once. Oh, would you mind watering my office plants while I'm away?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd be glad to.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, you're the best.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Here.  Thanks.  Anyone need a refill?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Roz
text: No thanks.

speaker: Roz
text: "Transference," my ass.  You've got it bad.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, what am I supposed to do?

speaker: Roz
text: Fight for her.  I mean, who is this Frank guy?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I don't know.  Some kind of environmental activist.

speaker: Roz
text: That's your competition?  Some tree-hugging geek?  Come on, you're one of the most eligible bachelors in town - in your age range. _Frasier takes note of her qualifier.  A young, rugged man comes in and looks around._

speaker: Frank
text: Charlotte.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Hi, honey.

speaker: Roz
text: You're screwed.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Frank, this is Frasier, the one I was telling you about.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi.

speaker: Frank
text: Hi, how are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Good, thank you.

speaker: Charlotte
text: And his producer, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi.

speaker: Frank
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, I understand you're going camping.

speaker: Frank
text: Yeah.  I raised some eagle hatchlings when their mother was killed by a hunter and now we're going to go release them in the wild.

speaker: Roz
text: How can you tell when it's time?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Well, one of them ate his landlord's cat.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, if they're still hungry, my dad has a dog.

speaker: Frank
text: Hey, you're funny.  You know, I know a lady who'd love your sense of humor.  She's a ranger up at Mount Raineer.  She comes down every couple of months for supplies if you'd like to meet her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, uh, thanks but, you know, I haven't had much luck with the women of the Parks Department.  _Charlotte laughs again.  FADE OUT.  End of Act 1  Act 2_ **THE SINGLES SCENE**

speaker: Frasier
text: Wow, Roz, did you feel that?  The entire room changed when we walked in.  It's like animals in the wild sensing a predator had arrived.

speaker: Roz
text: Good, I like that you're confident.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I was talking about you.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, now look, this is the drill: I brought you here to get your mind off of Charlotte.  Everyone's here for the same reason, so just pick someone and be yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.  What name should I use?

speaker: Kim
text: Excuse me, another cosmo, please.

speaker: Roz
text: Buy that drink.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, faint heart never won fair...

speaker: Roz
text: Buy the drink!

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Barkeep, uh, that one's on me. [_to the woman_] If you don't mind.

speaker: Kim
text: Mind?  Why do you think I said it so loud?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Roz_] What do I do now?

speaker: Roz
text: Just don't be so nervous.  And don't worry, I won't leave you until you make a connection.

speaker: Man
text: Hi.

speaker: Roz
text: Or I do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, hi.  I'm Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Kim
text: Kim.  So, you're a doctor?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I am.  I have a small practice here in town and...

speaker: Kim
text: Do you do collagen?  Because I could barter frequent flyer miles.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I'm not that kind of doctor.  I'm a psychiatrist.

speaker: Kim
text: Oh, you've probably got me figured out already.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no.  I haven't even got you on the couch yet.

speaker: Kim
text: Oh, my God!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  That was too aggressive.

speaker: Kim
text: No, no, I had a fortune cookie this morning that said I was going to meet a doctor.  I was afraid I was sick.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you look awfully healthy to me.

speaker: Kim
text: Oh, my God!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God, too aggressive again?  I'm so sorry.

speaker: Kim
text: No, no.  I love this song.  Come on, Dr. Frasier, loosen up. I'm sorry, what's your first name again?  _DISSOLVE TO: Frasier and Kim at a table. A waiter is bringing them fresh drinks, but Frasier hasn't finished his last one._

speaker: Kim
text: The first few months I was a wreck.  We were engaged. At least, I was.  But now, I know I'm ready to move on. [_suggestively_] Really, really ready.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, it's kind of funny.  I'm actually trying to get over someone myself, in a manner of speaking.

speaker: Kim
text: And you thought she was the one, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, she may have been.  I'm just trying to put her out of my mind, right now.  I must say, you're proving to be a delightful distraction.

speaker: Kim
text: Well, that's not the nicest thing anybody's ever called me in a bar, but it's not the worst.  This is fun.  But, I'm kinda thinkin' that I'd like to go someplace a little less... crowded.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.  Uh, well, thank you, I enjoyed our time together.

speaker: Kim
text: No, I meant someplace... a little more private.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I understand completely.  I take no offence.

speaker: Kim
text: Your place.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, yes indeed.  Well, should we go together to my place or...?  Well, you must have your own car so I could give you directions or, well, we could drive together and then I could drive you back here or we could drive together and then you could get a cab back here...

speaker: Kim
text: I don't care how we get there, let's just get there!  _Frasier smiles at this.   FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment  Fade in.  Frasier is at the dining table, pouring two glasses of wine. He adjusts the lighting and turns on the stereo as the doorbell rings. He "suavely" dances over to the end of the couch._

speaker: Frasier
text: It's unlocked.

speaker: Niles
text: It's unsafe!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God.

speaker: Niles
text: Anyone could walk in.

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell are you two doing here?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we came to cheer you up with some late night fast food.

speaker: Niles
text: If anything's gonna make you forget a woman, it's a big Double Juicy.

speaker: Daphne
text: Please, take it.  If you don't, he will.  I've created a monster.  He's already had two chimichangas and a You Ain't Nothin' But a Corndog.

speaker: Niles
text: All for less than four dollars.  Where has this food been all my life?

speaker: Frasier
text: On the end of a coroner's artery scraper!  What the hell has happened to you?  You've devoted your whole life to developing your standards, only to succumb to the fast, the cheap and the tasty.

speaker: Kim
text: Sorry, I turned the wrong way coming out of the elevator.

speaker: Kim
text: Oh, hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, Kim, this is my brother Niles and his wife Daphne.  They were just leaving.

speaker: Kim
text: Charmed.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Daphne
text: Nice to meet you.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I see I have my big Double Juicy and you have yours.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, good night!

speaker: Kim
text: Did somebody here have a chimichanga?

speaker: Daphne
text: See, I told you.  It's coming out of your pores.

speaker: Kim
text: Wow.  Nice place.  You really are a doctor.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Would you like the tour?

speaker: Kim
text: I don't know.  What do you want to show me?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know.  Uh, what do you want to see?

speaker: Kim
text: What would you like me to see?

speaker: Frasier
text: Whatever you came here to see.

speaker: Kim
text: And what did I come here to see?

speaker: Frasier
text: Is there and end to this?  Because I'm starting to feel redundant on my part.

speaker: Kim
text: Let's just have some fun

speaker: Frasier
text: You are delightfully single-minded.  Would you care for some wine?

speaker: Kim
text: Sounds great.

speaker: Kim
text: We both had a rough time lately.  How 'bout we go a little crazy tonight?

speaker: Frasier
text: I like the sound of that.

speaker: Kim
text: I've got a little outfit you might like.

speaker: Frasier
text: The littler it is, the more I like it!

speaker: Kim
text: I love it when I say something and then you say something funny.

speaker: Frasier
text: I tell you what, if you'd like to, you can change right in here.

speaker: Frasier
text: And, maybe I'll whip up a little surprise of my own.

speaker: Kim
text: Okay. _She pinches his rear and laughs as he closes the door.  He then rushes to the kitchen, taking off his shirt,  as she talks to him through the door._

speaker: Kim
text: When I met you tonight, I had no idea what a bad boy you were.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know what bad boys need, don't you?

speaker: Kim
text: A spanking, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: That, or a good tongue-lashing.

speaker: Kim
text: [_laughing_] Hah, you did it again! _Frasier comes in from the kitchen, a line of whipped cream down his chest, freezing when he sees the others.  Kim comes out of the powder room in a slinky black negligee.  Martin is shocked, Ronee is trying to contain her laughter._

speaker: Betty
text: My goodness!

speaker: Martin
text: What's goin' on?

speaker: Frasier
text: I thought you were out for the evening.  For God's sake...

speaker: Martin
text: We came back for dessert.

speaker: Ronee
text: Obviously you got a jump on us.

speaker: Frasier
text: This is horrible.  I'm so sorry.  I met, uh...

speaker: Kim
text: Kim.

speaker: Frasier
text: Kim at a bar earlier this evening, and obviously we hit it off.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, yeah, we get it.  Uh, look, there's a little coffee shop on the corner, why don't we go there for desert?

speaker: Ronee
text: You may get away with this now, young man, but once I'm your mother...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, get out!

speaker: Frasier
text: I would say "Perhaps another time," but that outfit goes a long way towards recapturing the mood.

speaker: Kim
text: Good.  Now why don't you just relax and I'll go find some ice for our wines. _She heads for the kitchen, oblivious to Frasier's pained look. He starts to sit down, but the doorbell rings._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good heavens!  _He answers the door to see Charlotte, looking disheveled in jeans and a flannel shirt._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I'm sorry to bother you, I just need my house keys.

speaker: Frasier
text: I thought you were camping.  Uh, come on in.  Gosh, I'm sorry about the stench in the hall.

speaker: Charlotte
text: That would be me.  I had a little run-in with a skunk. I thought I could scare him off if I threw my keys at him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, come on in.

speaker: Charlotte
text: You really don't want me to.  As it is now, I'm going to have to sell my car.  What is all over your chest?

speaker: Kim
text: Frasier, I... hello.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Okay, I got it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry, Charlotte, this is Kim.  Kim, this is Charlotte.

speaker: Kim
text: Boy, I've met more people in this apartment than I did at the bar.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I really didn't mean to interrupt.  If I could get my keys and use your powder room really fast.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, right.  It's right here and I'll get those for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, Kim, I'm terribly sorry about this.  I'm afraid it's just not going to work out for us tonight.

speaker: Kim
text: She's the one, isn't she?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.  Uh, listen, this has nothing to do with you, you know. I've had a lovely time this evening.

speaker: Kim
text: Me too.  Maybe it's just as well.  I'm lactose intolerant.

speaker: Kim
text: Good luck.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, your keys.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Thanks.  Where's your friend?

speaker: Frasier
text: She left.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  I didn't mean to spoil your night.

speaker: Frasier
text: You didn't.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Yes, yes I did!  I spoil everything.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, don't go there.

speaker: Charlotte
text: But it's true!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I mean, don't go there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sit over there, you'll be more comfortable.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I spoiled your evening.  I spoiled my clothes, I spoiled my whole relationship.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Frank and I had a huge fight.  He was getting impatient with me because, excuse me, I'm not exactly a pioneer woman and I started snapping back and the whole thing went downhill from there.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sure it wasn't as bad as all that.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I dropped the cooler on one of the hatchlings.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_] You know, maybe you could use a little wine.

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_chuckles_] I could.

speaker: Charlotte
text: But look at me, I can't stay in your house like this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, I'll tell you what: I have an eight-jet whirlpool bath that you are free to revive yourself in...

speaker: Frasier
text: ...and I can get cleaned up and make us some snacks, all right? And you know, actually, I have an endangered condor pate that I've been saving for just such an occasion.

speaker: Charlotte
text: That's not funny.  **CATCH ME A CATCH** _Scene 3 - Frasier's Apartment  Fade in.  Charlotte is in a robe on the couch, Frasier next to her pouring the wine._

speaker: Frasier
text: More wine?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Thanks.  This is my idea of camping.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'm not much of an outdoor man myself.  In college I got lost on a nature hike.  After screaming for forty-five minutes, I was finally rescued by a Brownie troop.  I still know some of their songs.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I still can't believe I haven't found the right woman for you yet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there's no rush.  I'm enjoying the search.

speaker: Charlotte
text: You're so sweet.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're sweet yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Charlotte, I hope you won't think this is too forward of me, but, a promising relationship doesn't come along very often and when it does, it's worth sticking your neck out for. What I'm saying is... _Martin and the Lawrence women come in the front.  Martin sees Charlotte and lets out an exasperated noise._

speaker: Betty
text: Good lord, he's with another one!

speaker: Frasier
text: For heaven's sake!

speaker: Martin
text: What are you doin' to me, boy?!

speaker: Charlotte
text: Maybe I'll just get those sweats you offered and get out of here.

speaker: Betty
text: All right, Veronica, we've had dessert, we've dropped him off, can we go now?

speaker: Ronee
text: No.

speaker: Betty
text: I don't want to spend another moment in this house!

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, fine, then you go, but I'm staying here with Marty.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sure, okay, Ronee, I'll just make up the couch for you.

speaker: Ronee
text: Just drop it, Marty.  Yes, Mother, we are sleeping together. And he's not the first.  Or the second.  In fact, I'm well into double digits now.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, we got the picture!

speaker: Ronee
text: Look, I'm sorry, I know you're upset, but I just can't live a lie anymore.  For God's sake, I'm in my forties.

speaker: Betty
text: What are you talking about?  You haven't been in your forties...

speaker: Ronee
text: All right!  I'll see you in the morning. _She pushes her mother out and shuts the door, then turns back to Frasier._ [_N.B. Wendie Malick - and presumably Ronee also - is fifty-four._]

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, if you're a good boy, maybe you'll get to spend the summer with your grandma. _She heads off to the bedrooms, passing Charlotte on the way. Martin takes the dessert box to the kitchen._

speaker: Charlotte
text: Thanks for the sweats.  And about before: I think I know what you were trying to say.

speaker: Frasier
text: You do?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Yes.  A promising relationship is worth fighting for.  So I called Frank and apologized and he's on his way home. Thank you for being there for me tonight.

speaker: Charlotte
text: You are such a good friend.

speaker: Charlotte
text: So I'll see you Monday?  Maybe we can get some coffee?

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Martin
text: I brought a little dessert back.  I don't suppose there's any whipped cream left.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry, no. _He settles on the couch and puts a hand to his head as Martin sits down._

speaker: Martin
text: You all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Martin
text: Want to talk about it?

speaker: Martin
text: Whew!  I gotta get this chair cleaned!

speaker: Frasier
text: She doesn't want me, she wants somebody else.  I don't have a chance.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm sorry. [_then_] That's the second one, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.

speaker: Martin
text: So, what are you gonna do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's a good question: What am I gonna do?  I suppose I could pine over her for the next several weeks, make myself more miserable every day.  Or I could do the sensible thing and just let her go. [_rising_] Excuse me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Charlotte, it's Frasier.   About coffee on Monday?  Let's just forget that.  How 'bout lunch instead? _He looks as if he can't believe he said this, but Martin gives him a smile and a wink of approval.  FADE OUT._
